h5.a: CLICK HERE FOR NYE COUNTY COMMUNITY RESOURCES

Please email questions and concerns to ncsdresponse@nyeschools.org
Your concerns will be forwarded to the appropriate person or department and may be addressed via future press releases.

li.a: Click here for the most recent information on NCSD's food distribution.

div.p: April 17, 2020

For the past several weeks, Nye County School District has monitored the number of positive COVID-19 cases in the county and evaluated the need to continue closures of schools, district offices, and facilities. The difficult, yet necessary, decision was made to remain closed through at least April 30, 2020. This decision is in compliance with Governor Sisolak’s Stay at Home directive issued April 1, 2020. The closures apply to all NCSD buildings and facilities; to all employees and the public.

Learning at a Distance for our students will continue as will district processes that can be completed remotely and/or electronically. In addition, food distribution resumes Monday, April 20th at all school sites. The reinstatement of all other services will be evaluated over the next two (2) weeks as we continue to monitor positive COVID-19 cases in Nye County.

Again, this decision was not made lightly, but Nye County School District is in the best position to flatten the curve in the spread of the coronavirus. Please join us in our efforts and Stay Home for Nevada - Stay Home for Nye!
For more information, please visit the NCSD website or the NCSD Facebook page at:

div.h3: Food Distribution Begins Again for the Children of Nye County
div.p: Nye County School District will offer food to the students/children of Nye County beginning Monday, April 20, 2020. Both breakfast and lunch will be provided to every student/child 18 years of age and under. Food will be distributed Monday, Wednesday, and Friday each week during closure at centralized locations only, see chart below. At this time bus routes will not be utilized.

Nye County School District has been granted permission to serve meals for the weekend; therefore, two breakfast and two lunches will be served on Mondays and Wednesdays, and three breakfasts and three lunches will be served on Fridays.
Because the purpose behind school closures is to limit congregating, please remain in your vehicle and food will be brought to you.
Pre-K, Elementary, Middle, and High School breakfast and lunch food distribution will occur at all school sites, see chart below for locations and times.
Beatty food distribution will occur at the elementary school. See chart below for location and times.
Amargosa food distribution will occur at 3 van stops, see chart below for locations and times.
Tonopah Elementary, Middle, and High School will distribute food at the Elementary and High School Sites, see chart below for locations and times.
Round Mountain area food will be distributed at the side door of the cafeteria, as well as 2 van stops, see chart below for locations and times.
Gabbs food distribution will occur at the school site, see chart below for location and time.
Yomba Tribe, food will be delivered to the families, see chart below for times.
*Two breakfasts and two lunches will be provided on Monday and Wednesday. Three breakfasts and three lunches will be provided on Friday.

In partnership with the Nevada Department of Public Safety, the SafeVoice program provides students a safe place to submit tips concerning their own safety or that of others. A fully trained professional team of experts responds in an appropriate manner 24/7/365. Tips always stay anonymous. The SafeVoice reporting system can be accessed by clicking on the link above or calling 833-216-SAFE.
